item.title: Notes on the Cube Nuroad Pro FE
item.description: The Cube Nuroad Race FE provides amazing value for money and is one of the better equipped bikes at the Â£1,250 price point. However, to be that agressively priced, and be fully equipped (hence FE in the name) with a rack, mudguards, dynamo, and front and rear lights, some corners had to be cut and some compromises made. This list isn’t meant to be a review (though I do love my one) but rather a collection of information I’ve come to learn about it over a year’s worth of riding, indoors and out, on tarmac and gravel.

item.title: Viewing Bazel logs using LNAV
item.description: Bazel doesn’t support streaming logs to the terminal, which means that long Bazel builds are about as fun as watching paint dry. Fair enough - you shouldn’t be there babysitting your builds anyway - but sometimes a little more information is nice to see, especially when developing a new rule. While it’s possible to tail -f or less +F the files in bazel-out/_tmp/actions, it can be annoying to deal with output of rules you don’t currently care about.

item.title: Westinghouse ceiling fan remote control with Home Assistant
item.description: The Westinghouse Bendan ceiling fan comes with an infrared remote control (model number ID6) which is used to set the fan speed and turn the light on and off. I’ve wanted to control the fan speed via my phone for a while, and have managed to do this using Home Assistant and a Broadlink RM3 Mini. Linking the RM3 Mini to Home assistant Adding the RM3 Mini to Home Assistant was relatively simple - but don’t bother with any of the instructions about setting up scripts as it’s easier to set the codes manually.
